text:
Raskolnikov sat still, ignoring the others. 

“One of her customers must have killed her,” Zossimov said.

“Not a doubt of it,” Razumihin replied. 

“Examining them?” Raskolnikov asked.

“Yes. What then?” Razumihin shrugged.

“Nothing.” 

“How does he get hold of them?” Zossimov inquired.

“Koch gave some names. Others came forward themselves.”

“It must have been a cunning ruffian!” Zossimov exclaimed.

“Not at all!” Razumihin interjected. “He’s probably inexperienced. 

It was his first crime. Chance saved him. 

He ransacked her trunks, took jewels worth ten or twenty roubles.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** the old pawnbroker's possession, indicating the murder was likely committed by an inexperienced individual rather than a cunning criminal.
